instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead hot cpu 19V 0.040A
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead hot cpu 19V 0.040A no water damage.

ppvbus -20v
pp3v3-3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> 5V
<SIGNAL>PP5V1_S4SW</SIGNAL>-0V NO SHOERT
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - 5V
sys detect led working
sometimes its no for 2 secound look like charging with charging sound but most of the time is dead

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead hot cpu 19V 0.040A
threads.message: These boards are big waste of time, in most cases it's dead CPU because of overheating or dead SSD's

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead hot cpu 19V 0.040A
threads.message:
As random behaviour, can be bad solder underneath CPU.
Do not waste time with this board; internal CPU problem is a classic issue too.
